instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1297: What is A1297? A1297 is a model number for a 17 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Early 2009, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011 with EMC 2272, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2390, 820-2610, 820-2849, 820-2914..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> takes 9 hours to charge to 100%
threads.message:
Hi Guys,
An interesting case here. <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> takes about 9 hours to charge the new battery completely.
The previous battery which was replaced (less than 6 months ago) also had a similar issue where it took longer to charge. Then suddenly stop charging and drained to 0%.

With the replaced battery still similar slow charging issues.
Genuine 85W Charger, "Genuine"ish battery

iStats shows only 411mA charging current.

[ATTACH type="full" alt="20211206_142313.jpg"]60300[/ATTACH]

Looking at DC-IN sensors seems to be pulling consistently 2-3.5A (adapter is capable of 4.6A and is getting noticeably hot)
[ATTACH type="full"]60301[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> takes 9 hours to charge to 100%
threads.message:
" "Genuine"ish battery "
What this means, is or not original Apple battery?
If not and old one also fake, that could be the problem.

Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>, just in case.
Check exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Also test disconnecting BIL (J6955).
